publishedBibles.derived: Masoretic Text, Westcott and Hort 1881 and Tregelles 1857

translations.name: American Standard Version
translations.description: The Revised Version, Standard American Edition of the Bible, more commonly known as the American Standard Version (ASV), is a version of the Bible that was released in 1901. It was originally best known by its full name, but soon came to have other names, such as the American Revised Version, the American Standard Revision, the American Standard Revised Bible, and the American Standard Edition. By the time its copyright was renewed in 1929, it had come to be known by its present name, the American Standard Version. Because of its prominence in seminaries, it was in America sometimes simply called the \\\"Standard Bible\\\".

translations.name: American Standard Version
translations.description: The Revised Version, Standard American Edition of the Bible, more commonly known as the American Standard Version (ASV), is a version of the Bible that was released in 1901. It was originally best known by its full name, but soon came to have other names, such as the American Revised Version, the American Standard Revision, the American Standard Revised Bible, and the American Standard Edition. By the time its copyright was renewed in 1929, it had come to be known by its present name, the American Standard Version. Because of its prominence in seminaries, it was in America sometimes simply called the \\\"Standard Bible\\\".

translations.name: Douay–Rheims Bible
translations.description: The Douay–Rheims Bible is a translation of the Bible from the Latin Vulgate into English made by members of the English College, Douai, in the service of the Catholic Church. The New Testament was reprinted in 1600, 1621 and 1633, while both the Old Testament volumes were reprinted in 1635. The Douay-Rheims Bible is in the public domain.

translations.name: Douay–Rheims Bible
translations.description: The Douay–Rheims Bible is a translation of the Bible from the Latin Vulgate into English made by members of the English College, Douai, in the service of the Catholic Church. The New Testament was reprinted in 1600, 1621 and 1633, while both the Old Testament volumes were reprinted in 1635. The Douay-Rheims Bible is in the public domain.

translations.name: Third Millennium Bible
translations.description: The Third Millennium Bible is an update to the Authorized 1611 KJV. While using more modern language than the Authorized Version, it attempts to preserve the 1611’s Jacobean language. The Third Millennium Bible comprises all the books contained in the KJV including the Old Testament, the New Testament, and the Deuterocanonical Books.

translations.name: Third Millennium Bible
translations.description: The Third Millennium Bible is an update to the Authorized 1611 KJV. While using more modern language than the Authorized Version, it attempts to preserve the 1611’s Jacobean language. publishedBibles.derived: Masoretic Text (Biblia Hebraica Stuttgartensia, 1983), Nestle-Aland Greek text

translations.name: Today's New International Version
translations.description: Today's New International Version (TNIV) is an English translation of the Bible based on the NIV and published in 2005. Like its predecessor, the NIV, it is explicitly Protestant, which means that the deuterocanonical books are not present. 53 scholars, many of them experts on specific books of the Bible, reviewed the translations teams' work. The translation took more than 10 years to complete and was published by Zondervan and Hodder & Stoughton.

publishedBibles.derived: Masoretic Text, Erasmus' third NT edition (1522), Martin Luther's 1522 German Bible.

translations.name: Tyndale Bible
translations.description: The Tyndale Bible is not a complete translation of the Bible, but rather a collection of William Tyndale’s translations completed prior to his execution, the New Testament and good portion of the Old Testament. Tyndale worked directly from Hebrew and Greek texts in his effort to make an easily read English Bible. His work was hugely influential to every major English translation of the Bible that followed.

translations.name: Tyndale Bible
translations.description: The Tyndale Bible is not a complete translation of the Bible, but rather a collection of William Tyndale’s translations completed prior to his execution, the New Testament and good portion of the Old Testament. Tyndale worked directly from Hebrew and Greek texts in his effort to make an easily read English Bible. His work was hugely influential to every major English translation of the Bible that followed.

translations.name: Webster's Revision
translations.description: Webster’s Revision or The Common Version is Noah Webster's 1833 revision of the King James Version. Its main purpose was lexical and not theological. Webster, who is more famous for his dictionary, replaced a few archaic words and made some minor grammatical changes. The changes were so slight that the Webster’s Revision is almost indistinguishable from the King James Version.

translations.name: Webster's Revision
translations.description: Webster’s Revision or The Common Version is Noah Webster's 1833 revision of the King James Version. Its main purpose was lexical and not theological. Webster, who is more famous for his dictionary, replaced a few archaic words and made some minor grammatical changes. The changes were so slight that the Webster’s Revision is almost indistinguishable from the King James Version.

translations.name: Young's Literal Translation
translations.description: Young’s Literal Translation, sometimes referred to as the YLT, is an extremely literal translation of the Bible by the Scottish printer Robert Young who is also known for his Analytical Concordance to the Bible. It was published in 1862 and is considered closer to the Hebrew than the more modern translations of the Bible.

translations.name: Young's Literal Translation
translations.description: Young’s Literal Translation, sometimes referred to as the YLT, is an extremely literal translation of the Bible by the Scottish printer Robert Young who is also known for his Analytical Concordance to the Bible. It was published in 1862 and is considered closer to the Hebrew than the more modern translations of the Bible.

translations.name: Ostervald's French Bible
translations.description: La Bible Ostervald a été une référence et largement utilisée pendant 150 ans, jusqu'à la fin du 19ème siècle. Mais elle reprit de la popularité vers la fin du 20ème siècle avec l'édition 1996. Toutefois cette dernière manque de précision et de fidélité au Texte Original du Nouveau Testament ou Texte Reçu, c'est pourquoi nous avons trouvé bon de mettre enligne ici l'édition 1877 original de la Bible Ostervald afin de donner aux fidèles un outil de comparaison grandement nécessaire.

translations.name: The Giovanni Diodati Bible
translations.description: Originally published in 1987 as only the 4 Gospels, The 2002 Good News Bible provides Italian protestants with a modern translation of God's Word. Copyright: © La Buona Novella Inc. – Switzerland

translations.name: The Bible of the Americas
translations.description:
Most Spanish-speaking Christians rely on one version of the Bible, the Reina Valera, which was first published in 1569, 42 years before the King James Version. In the absence of an exact, modern translation, many people are turning to paraphrases of God's Word. Recognizing the critical need for a highly accurate, contemporary translation of the Bible, The Lockman Foundation has produced La Biblia de las Américas(The Bible of the Americas).

This is a new translation of the Scriptures from the original languages. Completed in 1986 by a team of Latin American evangelical Bible scholars, La Biblia de las Américasis an original work translated from the Hebrew-Aramaic and Greek directly into modern Spanish. La Biblia de las Américas presents the Word of God in a clear and flowing style while strictly adhering to the Hebrew and Greek texts. Following the same principles of translation set for the NASB La Biblia de las Américas is understandable to the general public and also suitable for serious study.

translations.name: New Living Translation
translations.description: The Holy Bible, New Living Translation (NLT ) is a new translation that took ten years to complete. It is the work of more than fifty scholars in the arenas of theology, translation, linguistic studies, editing, correcting grammar, typography , editing and others. It also represents a partnership between several ministries and publishers such as Tyndale publisher, the Editorial Unilit, and The Luis Palau Association .

translations.name: Bible Study Tools
translations.description_short: BibleStudyTools.com is the largest free online Bible website for verse search and in-depth studies.
